results.title: Principles of gas filled tubes
results.creator_credit: Division of Visual Aids and F.E. Brooker
results.brief_description: Theory of ionisation applied to gas-filled tubes; control of current in circuits employing gas-filled tubes; use of the gas diode as rectifier; action of the grid in a gas triode; and application of the gas triode as a grid controlled rectifier.

results.title: Principles of electricity
results.brief_description: Breaks down the structure of matter into atoms and shows the action of electron within an atom. Explains the units of pressure, electric current and resistance (the volt, ampere, and ohm) as the principles involved in the flow of electricity. Discusses the essence of magnetism and magnetic fields. Shows how magnetic fields function in the generation and application of electricity.

results.title: Principles of cooking
results.brief_description: A study of the fundamental processes involved in the familiar methods of cooking: boiling, frying, broiling, roasting, and steam cooking. Each process illustrates to show food properties are changed by applying heat in this manner; the process is described in terms of its effect on the nutritive value of the foods being cooked and the palatability, animation being used to show changes which take place in starch and meat when heat is applied. The advantages and disadvantages of various methods are pointed out.

results.title: Principles of chromatography
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions and J.D. Chambers
results.brief_description: Demonstrates in an experimental way, the techniques afforded by chromatography for separating mixtures of closely related chemical substances. Provides some interesting and informative sequences.

results.title: Principles for creating clothing
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of sewing and discusses the devices and fabrics used in sewing. Shows how fabric behaves as it moves in light and shadow. Weave and grain are challenges which have sparked designs for centuries.
